Title: A Review on Machine Learning Strategies for Real-World Engineering Applications
Institutions: University Arts, Sciences and Technology, Computer Science Department, Beirut, Lebanon
Image Captions: Logo of the journal 'Babylonian Journal of Machine Learning', along with article information and DOI link.
Fig. 1. World wide trend analysis on machine learning techniques
Page Summaries: This page is a review article from the 'Babylonian Journal of Machine Learning' discussing various machine learning strategies for real-world engineering applications. It details the significance of machine learning in areas such as intelligent control, decision-making, speech recognition, and more. The article aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of how different machine learning approaches can be applied in real-world cases like cybersecurity, healthcare, and intelligent transportation, highlighting challenges and future prospects in this field.

This page discusses various types of machine learning techniques, including supervised learning, unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, and semi-supervised learning. It provides a brief description of each type and examples of their common applications. The page also includes a figure showing a worldwide trend analysis on machine learning techniques.

This page discusses various applications of machine learning, including Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Predictive Analytics, and Robotics and Autonomous Vehicles. It highlights the key techniques and models used in each area and concludes with the significant impact of machine learning on automation and intelligence.

This page discusses recent works in real-time engineering applications focusing on Intelligent Tutoring Systems (ITS) and Machine Learning in Healthcare. It highlights the major applications and benefits of these technologies, including student modeling, feedback generation, content creation, and predictive analytics in ITS as well as precision medicine, medical imaging diagnosis, patient risk analytics, drug discovery, and virtual health assistants in healthcare.

This page discusses the current challenges and future research directions in the field of machine learning. Key concerns include explainable AI, data efficiency, ethics and fairness, security and robustness, and distributed machine learning. The page concludes with a comprehensive overview of machine learning techniques and their applications in real-time engineering systems. It also addresses conflicts of interest, funding, and acknowledgments.

This page contains a reference list for a journal article from the Babylonian Journal of Machine Learning, Vol. 2023. The references include various sources related to machine learning algorithms, their applications, and related challenges in different domains such as healthcare, educational systems, and software engineering.
